original_title: Job opportunities open up for Sri Lankans in Italy
original_body_lines: The Italian government will accept applications for jobs offered to non-European countries from March 27, 2023, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) said.

The SLBFE said in a statement that the Sri Lankan Embassy in Italy has officially informed the SLBFE of this and jobs will be offered under the three categories of seasonal workers, non-seasonal workers, and self-employed workers.

The SLBFE further said that suitable candidates can apply for jobs that include truck drivers, electricians, machine operators, as well as those in the construction, hotel, food, naval, tourism, and agricultural sectors.
Italy is offering 82,702 employment opportunities to non-European countries, including Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, India, Japan, and South Korea, the statement said.
Interested applicants can apply for the jobs via https://www.anpal.gov.it/assumere-lavoratori-non-comunitari-anno-2023. This site will accept applications from March 27, 2023.
